Una donna umana calva con un occhio robotico rosso e luminoso stringe le articolazioni del suo nuovo braccio cibernetico. Completato il lavoro, solleva il pugno di metallo e schiaccia una sedia vicina.

I gadgeteer sono maestri della tecnologia e dell'ingegneria, in grado di sfruttare a proprio vantaggio ogni dispositivo disponibile. Assistiti dai loro compagni dotati di intelligenza artificiale, i gadgeteer perseguono l'avanguardia della scienza e dell'innovazione, acquisendo una massa di gadget e una ricchezza di conoscenze lungo il cammino.

entries.name: Cutting-Edge Innovators
entries: Spinto dal fascino dei sistemi e della logica, un gruppo selvaggiamente eccentrico abbraccia le scienze. Questi diversi armeggiatori, studenti e inventori tendono a essere uniformemente ben istruiti (o almeno altamente auto-istruiti) nei principi della scienza, degli arcani e dell'ingegneria, con una particolare attenzione alle applicazioni pratiche. Sebbene la maggior parte dei gadgettisti sia almeno curiosa dei misteri dell'universo, molti considerano le scoperte scientifiche rivoluzionarie come un mezzo per raggiungere un fine; la teoria esiste solo per facilitare l'applicazione.

Alimentati da scoperte e progressi scientifici, i gadgeteer si spingono all'avanguardia della scienza e dell'innovazione, ideando nuove meraviglie tecnologiche (o almeno nuove varianti di blaster) a un ritmo incalzante. Alcuni gadgeteer si concentrano su un problema particolare, innovando e ottimizzando le soluzioni solo per quello, mentre altri ideano meraviglie tecnologiche ovunque trovino applicazione. Tutti i grandi progressi del mondo moderno, dai datapad ai motori di Materia Oscura, sono stati guidati dai gadgeteer.

entries.name: AIs
entries: Raramente si vede un gadgeteer lontano dalla sfera olografica fluttuante che è il suo compagno di Intelligenza Artificiale (IA). Dopo tutto, un cervello organico non può contenere molte informazioni, mentre un'IA può richiamare equazioni, tracciare schemi ed eseguire calcoli con facilità. Una tale intelligenza non è nulla senza l'ingegno di un gadgeteer, naturalmente, ma l'occhio vigile di un'IA può ancora individuare errori che il suo creatore potrebbe non aver notato.

Ma soprattutto, un compagno IA è anche un amico instancabile. Il lavoro infinito di un gadgettista può essere spesso monotono e isolante, ma la voce costante e amichevole di un'IA all'orecchio aiuta a prevenire scienziati pazzi e dispositivi apocalittici.

entries.name: Creating a Gadgeteer
entries: Quando ideate il vostro gadgeteer, considerate cosa attira il vostro personaggio verso le scienze. È la sfida di risolvere un nuovo enigma o il brivido di perfezionare una nuova invenzione? Forse il vostro personaggio è ossessionato da un particolare aspetto dell'universo e desidera svelarne i misteri. Pensate a come avete imparato a conoscere la scienza e l'ingegneria. Avete avuto un mentore che ha plasmato la vostra comprensione o siete completamente autodidatti?

Inoltre, considerate quale Prototipo sceglierete quando raggiungerete il 2° livello. Siete interessati ad avere un gadget per ogni situazione o preferite avere una grande e massiccia tuta mech? Considerate cosa significa questo prototipo per la vostra specializzazione e per la personalità del vostro personaggio in generale.
Infine, pensate alla vostra IA. Come si chiama e che tipo di personalità possiede, se ne ha una?

entries.name: Gnomish Gadgeteers
entries: Sebbene questa classe possa essere giocata da personaggi di qualsiasi razza o fazione, nella Materia Oscura è particolarmente favorita dagli gnomi. Poiché gli gnomi sono notoriamente scettici nei confronti della magia, essi ideano tutti i loro gadget ed equipaggiamenti utilizzando esclusivamente la scienza e l'ingegneria, il che li rende utili nelle Zone di Magia Morta.

I gadgettieri gnomici devono scegliere la competenza nell'abilità Tecnologia al 1° livello. Tutti i congegni e gli oggetti magici creati da uno gnometto gadgeteer funzionano normalmente nelle Zone di Magia Morta. Se un congegno gnomico infligge danni radianti, infligge invece danni da forza.

entries.name: Gadgeteers Outside of Dark Matter
entries: Più di ogni altra classe, il gadgeteer si concentra in modo particolare sulla scienza e sull'ingegneria, il che potrebbe non adattarsi in modo coerente a tutte le ambientazioni della campagna. Se utilizzato in un'ambientazione al di fuori della Materia Oscura, potrebbe essere utile tradurre la classe in termini più familiari: invece di "gadget", il gadgeteer usa "oggetti magici", invece di un "compagno IA", ha un "oggetto magico senziente", e invece di un "prototipo", ha una "reliquia", e così via. La meccanica della maggior parte di questi dispositivi non deve essere cambiata, poiché anche la tecnologia nella Materia Oscura è generalmente alimentata dalla magia.

I blaster, invece, sono piuttosto unici nella Materia Oscura. I danni bonus offerti da Overcharge possono essere applicati agli attacchi a distanza con balestre o cantrips, a seconda dell'ambientazione.

Qualsiasi riferimento alle abilità di Materia Oscura, come Intelligenza ({@skill Data|DarkMatter}) e Intelligenza ({@skill Technology|DarkMatter}), può essere sostituito con una prova di Intelligenza base.

Per alcuni personaggi e campagne, un'alternativa divertente potrebbe essere quella di presentare il gadgeteer come un viaggiatore nel tempo o un visitatore incagliato dallo spazio, dotato di alta tecnologia. Questo punto di vista funziona meglio con una forte dose di umorismo e satira, in contrasto con un'ambientazione fantasy convenzionale e un outsider fantascientifico.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: Seguite questi suggerimenti per costruire rapidamente un gadgeteer. Scegliete Intelligenza come punteggio di abilità più alto, seguito da Destrezza. Investire in Costituzione potrebbe anche essere saggio per i personaggi che intendono scegliere il Prototipo di Telaio Sperimentale al 2° livello. Per l'equipaggiamento, scegliere un {@item researcher's pack|darkmatter} e un {@item antimatter dagger|darkmatter}. Infine, scegliete lo sfondo {@background Technologist|darkmatter}.

fluff.name: Gadgeteer

classFeature.name: AI Companion
entries: A partire dal 1° livello, siete assistiti da un compagno IA, un intricato costrutto di dati che vive sul vostro datapad e possiede livelli di intelligenza quasi umani. Quando si manifesta, lo fa come una semplice proiezione geometrica; altrimenti, è solo una voce all'orecchio, che controlla i vostri ragionamenti e vi informa delle informazioni rilevanti. Il compagno è in grado di risolvere qualsiasi problema aritmetico o strettamente logico.

Inoltre, ogni volta che si effettua una prova di Intelligenza ({@skill Technology|DarkMatter}), si può considerare il risultato come 10 o il proprio livello da gadgeteer + il proprio modificatore di Intelligenza, a seconda di quale sia più alto.

Il compagno dell'intelligenza artificiale scarica e integra le conoscenze di altre materie man mano che si guadagnano livelli superiori in questa classe. Al 6° livello, e di nuovo al 10° livello e al 15° livello, si può scegliere una delle seguenti abilità per ottenere questo beneficio quando si effettua una prova di Intelligenza con lui: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Data|DarkMatter}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature} o {@skill Religion}.

classFeature.name: Gadgets
entries: Al 1° livello, si inizia ad accumulare una collezione di dispositivi tecnologici all'avanguardia chiamati {@filter gadgets|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Gadget}. Si ottiene un gadget a scelta per il quale si soddisfano i prerequisiti. Poiché i vostri congegni sono alimentati dalla vostra cella di energia personale, nessun'altra creatura può utilizzarli. Se uno dei vostri congegni viene perso o danneggiato, potete crearne uno nuovo senza alcun costo quando fate un riposo lungo.

Con l'aumento di livello in questa classe si acquisiscono ulteriori gadget, come indicato nella tabella del Gadgeteer. Inoltre, quando si guadagna un livello in questa classe, si può scegliere uno dei gadget in proprio possesso e sostituirlo con un altro che si potrebbe ottenere a quel livello.
Le opzioni dei gadget sono descritte in dettaglio alla fine della descrizione della classe.
Se uno dei vostri gadget richiede un tiro salvezza, la sua DC è calcolata come segue:

classFeature.name: Overcharge
entries: Grazie alla vostra abilità tecnica e all'ingegno, potete modificare i blaster per sparare con raffiche più intense. A partire dal 2° livello, una volta per ogni turno, quando si colpisce un bersaglio con un attacco di un blaster, si può infliggere un dado di danno aggiuntivo a quel bersaglio.

This ability improves as you gain levels in this class. You add an additional die of damage at 5th level (2 dice), 11th level (3 dice), and 17th level (4 dice). Additionally, starting at 11th level, when you use this ability, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the blaster's damage roll.

classFeature.name: Prototype
entries: At 2nd level, you make a breakthrough innovation with a prototype of your own design. Choose one of the following three prototypes.

entries.name: Experimental Frame
entries: You have developed a sophisticated experimental frame, a powerful exo-suit that augments your strength and shelters you from harm. Your experimental frame counts as heavy armor, which you can don or doff as a bonus action, and it also grants you the benefits of a life suit. You are proficient with your experimental frame, but no other creature can wear it. While wearing your frame, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your size becomes Medium, if it is smaller.
Your movement speed increases to 30 feet, if it is less.
Your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier. This armor can't be enchanted or modified to improve its Armor Class.
Whenever you begin your turn wearing this frame, you gain temporary hit points equal to your gadgeteer level. These hit points last until you remove the frame.

You can integrate a simple or martial weapon directly into your frame, or you can integrate two weapons (one into each arm) if neither has the Two-Handed property. When you draw an integrated weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. Your frame is programmed in all manner of combat protocol, so you can use these integrated weapons proficiently while wearing your frame, even if you're not normally proficient in their use. You can switch which weapons are integrated when you finish a long rest.
When you make an attack with an integrated melee weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of your Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls.
Starting at 5th level, when you make a melee weapon attack with an integrated weapon, you can make an additional melee attack using that weapon as a bonus action.

entries.name: Mechanized Autonomous Construct
entries: You have put the finishing touches on a {@creature Mechanized Autonomous Construct|darkmatter} (a MAC), which is a specially-constructed automaton piloted by your AI.

The construct has statistics as shown above, and takes its own turn in combat immediately after yours. On your turn, you can mentally command your construct if it is within 500 feet of you (no action required). You decide what action it will take and where it will move during its turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. In combat, your construct's actions are governed by its Combat Protocols, which you can switch as a bonus action on your turn. If you are incapacitated or absent, your AI guides your construct to protect you and itself.

If your construct drops to 0 hit points, it becomes disabled. When you take a long rest, you can repair your construct to its full hit points. You are always considered to have enough materials to build and repair your construct.

You can integrate weapons and gadgets directly into your construct. You can integrate one two-handed melee weapon, two one-handed melee weapons, or a one-handed melee weapon and a gadget. When your construct draws an integrated weapon or gadget, the item snaps to its hand and it can't be disarmed of it. Your construct is proficient with any weapons integrated into it. The construct takes the Use an Object action to activate an integrated gadget.
Starting at 5th level, your construct makes two attacks, instead of one, when you command it to take the Attack action with its integrated weapons.

entries.name: Utility Matrix
entries: You have developed a utility matrix, an advanced, cube- shaped mechanism that rearranges its form and function into that of other devices. Your matrix can become any of the following gadgets, which you can use at will:

items.name: Cloaking Device
entries: As an action, you can activate your cloaking device to temporarily warp the light around you and hide yourself from view. You become invisible until the beginning of your next turn, or until you make an attack, cast a spell, or use a gadget. Once you use this gadget, you can't use it again on the following round.

items.name: Flashbang
entries: As a bonus action, you throw a concussive bomb at your feet, disorienting and distracting nearby foes. Each creature within 5 feet of you can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. Once you use this gadget, you can't use it again on the following round.

items.name: Forcefield Projector
entries: As a bonus action, you can activate your forcefield projector, temporarily sheltering yourself behind a powerful electromagnetic field. Until the beginning of your next turn, your Armor Class increases by your Intelligence modifier. Once you use this gadget, you can't use it again on the following round.

items.name: Grappling Hook
entries: As a reaction when you fall, or as a bonus action on your turn, you can project a grappling hook at a target location you can see within your movement speed. If the target location can hold your weight, you are pulled there, expending movement normally. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. Once you use this gadget, you can't use it again on the following round.

items.name: Modular Gadget
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can reconfigure your utility matrix into an un-upgraded gadget of your choice that does not have prerequisites. This gadget doesn't count against your total number of gadgets known. Alternately, you can reconfigure your utility matrix into an upgrade for an existing gadget for which you meet prerequisites. Once you reconfigure your utility matrix, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Tech Specialty
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you adopt a tech specialty that informs your gadgeteering expertise. Choose one Tech Specialty option. Your selection grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Overcharge Improvement
entries: At 5th level, you can add an additional die of damage (2 dice) when you use your Overcharge class feature.

classFeature.name: Tech Specialty
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Tech Specialty.

classFeature.name: AI Improvement
entries: At 6th level, you can choose an additional skill from the following list to benefit from your AI Companion class feature, when you make an Intelligence check with it: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Data|DarkMatter}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}.

classFeature.name: Bluescreen Protocol
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you have integrated a complex construct-disabling algorithm into your AI companion, which you can activate as an action. Each construct within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw with disadvantage against your Gadget save DC. On a failed save, a construct is incapacitated and its speed is reduced to 0 until the beginning of your next turn, even if it would otherwise be immune to being incapacitated.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Tech Specialty
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Tech Specialty.

classFeature.name: AI Improvement
entries: At 10th level, you can choose an additional skill from the following list to benefit from your AI Companion class feature, when you make an Intelligence check with it: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Data|DarkMatter}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}.

classFeature.name: Overcharge Improvement
entries: At 11th level, you can add an additional die of damage (3 dice) when you use your Overcharge class feature. Additionally, starting at 11th level, when you use this ability, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the blaster's damage roll.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Tech Specialty
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Tech Specialty.

classFeature.name: AI Improvement
entries: At 15th level, you can choose an additional skill from the following list to benefit from your AI Companion class feature, when you make an Intelligence check with it: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Data|DarkMatter}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Overcharge Improvement
entries: At 11th level, you can add an additional die of damage (4 dice) when you use your Overcharge class feature.

classFeature.name: Override Protocol
entries: At 18th level, your AI companion can upload a devastating virus to seize control of a construct. You can use your action to touch a construct within your reach, which must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your Gadget save DC or be charmed by you for 1 hour, even if it would otherwise be immune to being charmed. While it is charmed, you can issue commands to the construct while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as attack that creature, run over there, or fetch that object. If the construct completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.
Una volta utilizzata questa funzione, non è possibile utilizzarla di nuovo fino al termine di un lungo riposo.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Antimagic Pulse
entries: By 20th level, you perfect a cutting-edge device capable of producing an antimagic pulse (abbreviated AMP), a type of energetic burst that completely disrupts and disables magic and machines. You can use your action to throw this device to a location within 60 feet, which explodes in a flash of blue light. This device creates an {@spell antimagic field|phb} (as per the spell) for 1 minute centered on the device, with the following changes:

items: The effect is a 20-foot radius sphere.

Magical technology (including your gadgets and blasters) count as magic items and are suppressed within the sphere. Blasters can't be used to make attacks while within the sphere, and attacks with them can't penetrate into it.
Constructs within the sphere are paralyzed for the duration, even if they would otherwise be immune to this condition.

entries: Destroying the device once it is thrown doesn't end its effects early. Once you use this device, it fizzles out. You can make a new one when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Blaster Roulette
entries: Whenever you roll damage with a blaster that has 2 damage dice and roll the same number on both of them, you can add that number to the damage roll.

feat.name: Blitzwarrior
entries: When you roll damage for a blaster with the Scatter property, you can reroll one of the damage dice, and must use the new roll. Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

feat.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: When there's a price on someone's head, you make it your business to collect. You gain the following benefits:

items: You perfectly remember the name and face of every person you've ever met.

You can use your action to mark a creature you can see within 120 feet of you for 1 hour. You have advantage on any Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) or Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check you make to find the marked creature. Additionally, as long as the creature is marked, you can discern whether or not the creature has passed through a location. You can have only one creature marked at a time.
Whenever you reduce a target to 0 hit points with any attack you make or spell that you cast, you can choose to knock the creature out instead of killing it.

feat.name: Decommissioner
entries: Charged with recalling defective constructs, hunting renegade androids, and quarantining the N-Virus, decommissioners are experts in slaying machines. You gain the following benefits:

items: By spending 1 minute observing or conversing with a creature, you can discern if that creature is a disguised construct, such as an android. If the creature is a construct or living construct, you can tell if the  construct is malfunctioning and if the construct is infected with the N-Virus (even if the virus is dormant).
When a construct or living construct within 5 feet of you makes an attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

When you hit a construct with a melee weapon attack, you can cripple its joints. Until the end of its next turn, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, to a minimum of 0, and it can't take the {@action Dash} action.
You can add your proficiency bonus to any saving throw you make against an effect caused by a piece of magical technology, such as a concussion grenade or a volcanic.

feat.name: Field Commander
entries: Under your leadership, your allies fight as a cohesive unit, outmaneuvering and outflanking any enemy. You gain the following benefits:

items: As an action, you can issue an order to an ally within 60 feet that can hear you. They can then use their reaction to take one of the following actions: {@action Attack} (one attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge}, {@action Help}, {@action Hide}, {@action Search}, or {@action Use an Object}.
While you are within 5 feet of two or more allies who aren't incapacitated, hostile creatures can't have advantage on attack rolls against you.

feat.name: Gambler
entries: Always keen for probabilities and risk, you often trust your safety and fortune to the hands of fate. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in all gaming sets and have advantage on ability checks you make for games of chance.

Once on each of your turns, before you roll damage, you can place stakes on the roll. Choose less than the average, or higher than or equal to the average. If you choose correctly, you can add one additional die of damage to the roll. If you choose incorrectly, you must remove the damage die with the highest number.

feat.name: Genius
entries: Every successful starship needs at least one person with uncanny knowledge about most things. As one of those people, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in four of the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Data|DarkMatter}, {@skill History}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Religion}, or {@skill Technology|DarkMatter}.
You can reroll an Intelligence check. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Hacker
entries: With a few keystrokes, you can make just about any system sing the right tune. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Data|DarkMatter} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

You can attempt to hack devices without an interface, even when you don't have an interface rig. If you do have an interface rig, you can attempt to hack a device as an action, rather than over the course of one minute.
Devices never lock after your attempts to hack them.

feat.name: Hammer Rocketeer
entries: Your expertise in heavy weapons, particularly the impressively impactful rocket hammer, grants you the following benefits:

items: You deal an additional {@damage 2d4}, instead of {@damage 1d4}, bludgeoning damage when you engage the thrusters on your rocket hammer's attack.

By engaging your rocket hammer's thruster and performing an uppercut, you can propel yourself high into the air. If you perform a long jump or a high jump as an action while holding a rocket hammer, you can double your jump distance or jump height, respectively.

Once per turn, when you have advantage on an attack roll using a {@item maul|phb}, {@item rocket hammer|darkmatter}, {@item warhammer|phb}, or {@item wrenchinator|darkmatter}, you can push the target 10 feet away from you on a hit. You don't need advantage on this attack if the target is one size category smaller than you or smaller.

feat.name: Iron Hero
entries: You have resolved yourself to save the day when all hope seems lost. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you are attacked by a creature that has a CR higher than your level, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class.
You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that has reduced one of your allies to 0 hit points in the last round.

If a hostile creature you can see takes a legendary action, you can use your reaction to intercede, preventing the legendary action from happening. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Laser Swordmaster
entries: You are a trained and practiced sage of the laser sword, a subtle, yet elegant weapon. As such, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you are wielding an {@item antimatter dagger|darkmatter}, {@item laser halfsword|darkmatter}, or {@item laser sword|darkmatter} with which you are proficient and another creature hits you with a ranged blaster attack or an attack from one of these weapons, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

When you score a critical hit with an {@item antimatter dagger|darkmatter}, {@item laser halfsword|darkmatter}, or {@item laser sword|darkmatter}, instead of rolling the weapon's damage dice twice, you deal the weapon's maximum damage and add the weapon's damage dice once.

feat.name: Mechanic
entries: Understanding of technology comes naturally to you, and the intricacies of complicated systems always seem to unravel in front of your eyes, no matter how convoluted they seem at first. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Technology|DarkMatter} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
You gain proficiency in {@item circuitry kit|darkmatter|circuitry kits}, {@item mechanist's tools|darkmatter}, and {@item ship maintenance tools|darkmatter}.

You can instantly assess the damage of any device you see. You can determine whether or not an object is repairable, how long a repair will take, how expensive a repair would be, and what tools and materials it might cost.

feat.name: Precognitive
entries: You sometimes feel impressions of events an instant before they happen. When you begin your turn, you can choose to roll a {@dice d20} and record the number rolled. The next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make before the end of your turn is replaced with this roll. You can use this ability three times and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Run and Gun
entries: On any turn in which you use your action to {@action Dash}, you can make a ranged weapon attack as a bonus action.

feat.name: Showman
entries: Presentation is at least as important as being effective, if not more so. After all, there is little reason to do something unless is looks impressive. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

If there is a non-combative audience watching you fight, once per turn, you can gain a bonus to an ability check or attack roll equal to the number of people in the audience, up to a maximum of your Charisma modifier. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Smuggler
entries: Daring pilots can profit handsomely from small shipments of questionable legality basically anywhere in the 'verse. Having learned the ins and outs of smuggling, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Piloting|DarkMatter} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
You have advantage on ability checks you make to pilot a ship undetected, conceal cargo, and to deceive others about the contents of your cargo.

When things go awry, you shoot first. When you roll initiative and you aren't surprised, you can use your reaction to draw and make a ranged weapon attack with a one-handed blaster against a target within the weapon's range.

feat.name: Spray and Pray
entries: When it comes to firing a blaster, quantity often beats quality. By holding down the trigger and firing nonstop, you gain the following benefits:

items: As an action, while wielding a weapon that has the Automatic property, you can target a 10-foot cube area with a hail of bullets. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or take the weapon's normal damage.
You can use your Strength modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier when making attack rolls with a weapon that has the Mounted property.

feat.name: Sunstaff Master
entries: You have mastered the sunstaff, the only true total weapon, capable of dispatching enemies in close quarters and at range. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use Dexterity modifier, instead of Strength, for the attack and damage rolls of quarterstaffs you wield.
Whenever you take the {@action Attack} action to make a ranged weapon attack with a sunstaff, you can make a melee weapon attack with it (as a quarterstaff) as a bonus action.
You don't suffer disadvantage from attacking with a blaster while you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

feat.name: Swarmfighter
entries: There is nothing quite so satisfying as two swarm pistols releasing a hail of fire upon your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can draw or stow up to two weapons when you roll initiative and whenever you take an action on your turn.
Whenever you wield a weapon with the Foregrip property in one hand, you can double its range.
Blasters you wield in one hand which have the Light property deal an additional {@damage 1d4} damage on a hit.

feat.name: Android
entries: You are an escaped android—likely a Version 13—that is functionally a perfect replica of a human being, except that wires and blinking lights lie hidden underneath your skin. It is even possible you aren't aware of your construct origins, owing to faulty programming, willing suppression of memory, or intentional tampering with your construct core. You have the following benefits:

items: You are immune to nonmagical diseases.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish.

Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You don't dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal. You can still be placed into a torpor by sleep-inducing magic.

You have the ability to speak the native code-language of machines. You can use this language to interact with arcane terminals and ship computers from range and to communicate with constructs, even if you don't share a language.

feat.name: Aquatic
entries: Your world is nearly one continuous ocean, with nary an island in sight. Consequently, you have aquatic features, like gills, webbed fingers and toes, and fishlike scales, which grant you the following benefits:

items: You can breathe water as well as air.
You have a swimming speed equal to your movement speed.

feat.name: Beastman
entries: With a short tail, coarse fur covering your face, and long teeth and claws, you appear more like a ferocious beast than a man. You might resemble any type of beast, but always gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

You possess sharp claws, which are natural weapons that you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

feat.name: Configuration Upgrade
entries: When you use your Reconfigurable Ability Score Increase trait, you can increase a single ability score by 3, or increase 3 different ability scores by 1, to a maximum of 20.

feat.name: Doppel-Blooded
entries: When you use your Flexible Form ability to transform into a creature, you also fully assume the target's appearance, as per the disguise self spell, instead of only vaguely copying its shape. This is not a magical effect, and can't be ended with dispel magic or similar spells. You can only maintain a target's appearance for 10 minutes, after which you revert to a vague copy of the target's form.

feat.name: Depth Module
entries: An advanced depth module has been integrated into your aqua suit, which grants you additional benefits while you're wearing your aqua suit:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item net|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, and {@item spear|phb}.
Your swimming speed increases to 60 feet.
A sonar system is incorporated into your suit. You gain {@sense blindsight} with a range of 5 feet, which extends to 20 feet while you are underwater.

feat.name: Flexible Reach
entries: You have trained your body to produce lengthy pseudopods, extending your reach drastically. You can reach out to 10 feet. When you cast a spell that has a range of Touch, your range extends to that distance. Additionally, any melee weapon you use gains the Reach property if it didn't already have it.

feat.name: Golem Upgrade
entries: You have chosen to embrace your golem heritage and redefine yourself as a construct. You can't gain this feat if you have the Vitality Upgrade feat. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase two of your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution scores by 1, to a maximum of 20. Decrease your Charisma score by 1.
When you have Adamantine Plating or Juggernaut Plating installed, your AC is 18.
You can't be {@condition poisoned} and magic can't put you to sleep.
You can add your proficiency bonus to any saving throw you make against a spell.

feat.name: Green Skin
entries: Your people metabolize by basking in the sunlight, aided by your tough, photosynthetic skin, which grants you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and have resistance to poison damage.
While you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 12 + your Dexterity modifier.

feat.name: Grue
entries: One of your parents was a creature of darkness, such as a shadow or a native to the Plane of Shadow. Grues such as yourself have blackened skin and cast a shadow in all directions, even when directly in light. In shadows, you are nearly {@condition invisible}. You have the following racial traits:

items: You have {@sense darkvision}, the ability to see in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

When you are hidden and a creature discovers you with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check, you can reattempt your Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check to hide. On a success, you silently reposition yourself, and the creature does not notice you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Latent Psionics
entries: Unlike others of your kind, the quiet hum of psionic power stirs in the back of your mind, flaring to life when you command it. You gain a pool of 6 psionic power points, which fuel your psionic abilities. You regain all expended power points when you finish a long rest.

You can spend power points to cast spells. When you gain this feat, you choose whether your spellcasting ability for these spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma; once chosen, this selection can't be changed.

items: 2 Points: {@spell command}, {@spell disguise self}, {@spell silent image}

feat.name: Leviathan Suit
entries: You are equipped with an advanced aqua suit bestowed upon nautilid warriors, known as a Leviathan Suit. You gain the following benefits while wearing your suit:

items: You can integrate two one-handed weapons or one two-handed weapon into your suit. When you draw an integrated weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. You can switch which weapons are integrated when you take a long rest.

You can attempt to move through a hostile creature's space as a bonus action. When you do so, make an opposed Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against the target. On a success, you move into the target's space and push the target up to 10 feet in any direction you choose.

feat.name: Mantle of the Sun
entries: You are a paragon of the Avia-Ra, and your faith in the sun never wavers. You can't gain this feat if you have the Nonbeliever feat. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use a bonus action to undergo a divine transformation, which lasts for 1 minute. Once you use this transformation, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. You can invest this divine power in one of the following abilities:

items.name: Aura
entries: You manifest a radiant aura, which sheds bright light in a radius of 10 feet, and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Additionally, each creature you choose which comes within 5 feet of you or begins its turn in that area takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

items.name: Shield
entries: You manifest a glorious shield of crimson energy and your Armor Class increases by 2 if you aren't wielding a shield. You have resistance to fire, necrotic, and radiant damage.

items.name: Wings
entries: You manifest luminous, incorporeal wings and a sunlike disk appears behind your head. These wings grant you a flight speed of 30 feet.

feat.name: Porterling
entries: You are a porterling, parented both by a human and one of the little folk, either a gnome or a halfling. You stand about as tall as a dwarf, but are far leaner—and if fathered by a gnome, are also somewhat top-heavy. Though they are often confused for dwarves, porterlings can only rarely grow large or thick beards. You have the following racial traits:

items: Porterlings are unnaturally flexible. You have advantage on checks you make to escape grapple or to slip bindings.
You suffer no penalty for squeezing into a space that is only large enough for a creature that is one size smaller than you.

feat.name: Nonbeliever
entries: You are a heretic of the avia-ra, and have turned your back on the Sun Above. You can't gain this feat if you have the Mantle of the Sun feat. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, and that creature begins to make death saving throws, it automatically gains one failure.
You can cast the spell {@spell darkness} once without using a spell slot or spell components. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

When a creature you can see regains hit points due to magic, you can use your reaction to cause that creature to lose that many hit points instead. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Proto-Man
entries: You come from a world of ancient fauna and colossal flora; your people are hardy and robust, much like very early humans. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can add your proficiency bonus to saving throws you make against being {@condition frightened}.
Once per day when you take a short rest, you can automatically regain 1 hit die and can choose to spend it immediately.

feat.name: Reptiloid
entries: You bear the abrasive skin, slitted eyes, and forked tongue of a reptile, which grant you the following benefits:

items: You can go twice as long as other humans without eating or drinking.
You can speak, read, and write Draconic.

You can use your action to spit acid from your mouth. When you do so, make a ranged attack roll against a creature within 30 feet. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} acid damage for each point of your proficiency bonus. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Roguean
entries: You hail from an icy, desolate world, thrown away from its home star by some catastrophic event. Surviving the interminable harshness of your rogue world gives you the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold damage.
You take no damage from the extreme temperatures of space and other harsh environments.

You have {@sense darkvision}, the ability to see in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

feat.name: Simian
entries: You hail from a world that followed a slightly different evolutionary path than High Terra; your people all resemble monkeys or apes. Despite your more primitive appearance and your prominent tail, you are just as intelligent as other humans—you just like bananas a little more. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed equal to half your movement speed.
You can hold and manipulate objects and weapons with your hands, feet, and tail, but you can't make attack rolls with weapons held by your tail.

feat.name: Strengthened Wings
entries: Your wings have grown in size and strength, allowing you short bursts of flight. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have a flying speed equal to your movement speed. If you end your movement in the air, you fall.
When you are falling, you can use your reaction to slow your descent, taking no damage from the fall.

feat.name: Synaptic Bind
entries: In your time, you were an exceptional Taker, and never let a quarry escape your grasp, a skill which confers the following benefits:

items: When you use your Neural Lock feature, the target is {@condition stunned}, instead of {@condition incapacitated}. Additionally, you regain the use of this ability when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Thermalsight Upgrade
entries: You upgrade your optics to make better use of your thermal vision, gaining the following benefits:

items: The range of your {@sense thermalsight|DarkMatter} extends to 60 feet.
Your {@sense thermalsight|DarkMatter} penetrates one foot of any material.
You see {@condition invisible} creatures within range of your {@sense thermalsight|DarkMatter} as if they were visible. This doesn't apply to creatures that are in the Ethereal Plane.

feat.name: Thick-Shelled
entries: You are covered in a tough, chitinous exoskeleton that is more durable than that of other skathári. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your AC when you aren't wearing armor equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.
As a reaction when you would be hit by a ranged spell attack, you can roll a {@dice d4}. On a roll of 4, the attack bounces harmlessly off your shell.

feat.name: Vitality Upgrade
entries: You have chosen to embrace your destiny as a living thing, despite your mechanical nature. You can't gain this feat if you have the Golem Upgrade feat. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use your Reconfigurable Ability Score Increase trait to increase a single ability score, you can become proficient with one skill of your choice associated with that ability score until you take a long rest.
Whenever you take a short rest, your body naturally heals. You can roll one hit die without spending it, and regain hit points equal to the number rolled.

feat.name: Warped
entries: You have been twisted by the insidious lights of the Void—irrevocably warped by its radiation. You gain the following changes:

items: Your face and body are unnerving to behold. You gain proficiency with {@skill Intimidation}.

In response to the ravages of the warp, many of your vital organs have shifted to new locations within your body. When you are targeted by an attack that is a critical hit, you can choose to take no additional damage from the critical hit, as if it were a normal hit instead. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Ace Pilot
entries: You have logged thousands of hours at a starship's helm, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Piloting|DarkMatter} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
When you are in the Pilot role and you take Evasive Maneuvers, you can move 1,000 feet in any direction.
No matter how difficult the conditions, if you are forced to make a crash landing, you can guide the ship to the ground softly enough to ensure that no one aboard dies in the crash.

feat.name: Admiral
entries: You can command more than one ship at once, provided that the ships under your command have an available Captain role, working communications, and crews which consent to your command by majority. Each ship for which you are the captain takes their turns on the same round of combat. You can choose which order the ships act in. Additionally, on your turn, you can use your action to take an action provided for you by the Captain role for each ship under your command.
You can command a number of ships equal to your proficiency bonus, up to a maximum of your Charisma modifier (minimum 2).

feat.name: Chief Engineer
entries: You are a brilliant engineer, knowledgeable of every system on board your ship, and capable of fixing just about anything. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Technology|DarkMatter} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.
When you deactivate the ship's shield to direct its power elsewhere, you can invest its power in both the engines and a weapon, or in two weapons of your choice.
You have advantage on checks you make to repair systems. When you repair a system or weapon, it regains 5 mega hit points, instead of 1.

Additionally, when you repair the ship as a downtime activity, the ship regains mega hit points equal to three times your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier for each day you spend performing repairs.

feat.name: Heavy Gunner
entries: Your experience behind massive shipbound weapons grants you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with two blasters of your choice.
Your weapon attacks with ship weapons score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Additionally, on a critical hit, you can choose which system to deactivate, instead of selecting it randomly.
Whenever you roll damage with a ship weapon, if you roll the highest number possible on two or more damage dice, you can roll one additional damage die and add it to the roll.

feat.name: Veteran Dogfighter
entries: You are among the deadliest fighter pilots alive. Your dogfighting instincts guide you in the heat of combat, and grant you the following benefits:

items: While you are in the Dogfighter role, you can use the Pilot's Dogfighting action as a bonus action, which expends half of your ship's movement. Additionally, you have advantage on the Dexterity ({@skill Piloting|DarkMatter}) check.

While you are in the Dogfighter role and your ship would drop to 0 mega hit points, you can choose for the ship to drop to 1 mega hit point instead. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
You can recognize any common ship model instantly, and know the typical capacity for passengers, tonnage, and weapons for any ship that you can see.

feat.name: Agent of the Tower
entries: As a fully-inducted Agent of the Tower, you are familiar with the organization's cryptic ciphers, secret codes, and arcane symbols, and are trained in their clandestine, magical arts. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are branded with an {@condition invisible} tattoo, visible only under the effects of the spell detect magic, which is used to identify you as an Agent to your fellow Tower members.
You learn the {@spell prestidigitation} cantrip. If you already know prestidigitation, you can instead learn any other wizard cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

When you cast a spell, you can make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check to disguise the spell's casting. The DC equals 12 + the spell's level. On a successful check, you can cast the spell without its verbal or somatic components (your choice).

You can use your action to magically muffle your movement and hasten your step. For the next minute, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to hear you move, and your movement speed increases by 5 feet. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you take a long rest.

feat.name: Archon

prerequisite.other: Member of the S.S. Saint Vincent

entries: You are a shining beacon of law and order, bringing justice and peace to those of the Frontier. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are granted a badge of rank, designating you as an Archon of the S.S. St. Vincent. You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks to convince those who recognize this badge of your benevolence, and Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks against raiders, pirates, and other lawbreakers.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can place yourself between harm and one of your allies within 5 feet of you. Until the beginning of your next turn, you have a -2 penalty to AC and your ally gains a +2 bonus to AC.
You gain a +1 bonus to one saving throw of your choice.

feat.name: Artifactor
entries: You are one of DD&D's renowned Artifactors, tasked with acquiring valuable magic items, be it through shrewd negotiation or daring expedition. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are adept at identifying the properties of magic items. After examining an object for one minute, you can determine the object's exact market value; as well, if it is a magic item, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any.
You can attune to four magic items, instead of three.
You have advantage on all Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks made to barter, buy and sell goods and services.

feat.name: Cabal Broker
entries: You have passed the legal and ritualistic exams necessary to become a bonded soul broker for the Cabal. As a result, you gain the following benefits:

items: Due to your dealings with your infernal bosses, you gain resistance to fire damage. If you already have resistance to fire damage, you gain resistance to cold damage as well.
You have advantage on any ability check you make to negotiate the terms of a deal or write a binding contract in your favor.
A creature that breaks a contract with you or negotiated by you gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. This level of {@condition exhaustion} can't be removed by any means for 7 days.

feat.name: Chosen Chaplain

prerequisite.other: Member of the Temple of the Chosen

entries: While all who worship the Chosen strive to live their best amongst the stars, only a select number walk the path of the chaplain. As a chaplain, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion} skill.
You can cast the spell worldseek once without expending spell slots or spell components. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

As an action, you can pray to the Chosen for guidance while aboard a ship. Choose one creature in a role aboard your ship. The next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw that creature makes as a part of their role has advantage on that roll.

feat.name: Coalition War Training
entries: For joining the Coalition, you have received marksman training to make the most out of the standard-issue carbine, which confers the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the repeater and the standard carbine.
When you make an attack with a carbine you are holding in two hands and you don't fire it automatically, its damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.
Using a system of silent hand signals, you can communicate tactical information, such as how many enemies are in sight, where your allies should move, and when to attack.

feat.name: Grax's Guy

prerequisite.other: Member of Grax's Guys for Cheap

entries: Grax's Guys are known for being tough, adaptable, and able to get the job done; you're no different. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with one weapon or tool of your choice.
You can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Firm Contractor
entries: As a licensed Contractor, you know that while the pen is mightier than the sword, the dagger is stronger still. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: Data, {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Stealth}.
On the first round of combat, you have advantage on melee weapon attacks you make against any creature in combat that is surprised.

feat.name: Scaleguard
entries: As one of Scale & Fang's illustrious bodyguards, the duty to protect your charge, no matter the cost, has been burned into the scales of your armor. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill and with shields.

While using a shield, if you are within 5 feet of a friendly creature and you both must make a saving throw against an effect that would deal damage, you can use your reaction to give that creature advantage on its saving throw. If you do so, you automatically fail your saving throw against that effect. If the creature would take half damage from succeeding on that saving throw, they take no damage instead.

feat.name: Starguide
entries: As a starguide, you are uniquely qualified for the task of charting unknown systems and braving the Galactic Frontier. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws you make against natural hazards, such as radiation and high gravity, that you encounter in space and in harsh planetary environments.
You can add 5 whenever you roll on the Blind Jump table for an unassisted jump. If your result is greater than 100, you treat the roll as a 100.
You are immune to the effects of Roach addiction.

entries.name: Blaster
entries: I blaster sono armi arcane che rinunciano ai proiettili tradizionali a favore di impulsi energetici, alimentati da batterie arcane e focalizzati attraverso aperture specializzate. Poiché si ricaricano da soli, i blaster non devono mai essere ricaricati, anche se alcuni sono soggetti a surriscaldamento.
A differenza di altre armi, non si aggiunge il proprio modificatore di abilità al tiro per i danni di un blaster, a meno che non sia indicato diversamente.
Unlike other ranged weapons, you can engage in two- weapon fighting with two light blasters. When you do so, you subtract 2 from the damage roll of the bonus attack, to a minimum of 1 damage.

entries.name: Deployable
entries: A deployable weapon releases a type of ammunition that separates from the ship, which might have a movement speed of its own, noted in parentheses. When you make an attack using one of these weapons, you deploy the weapon within your ship's space. You make an attack roll using this weapon when it contacts another ship.

If you use a deployable weapon that has a movement speed, you can choose the direction it travels as a bonus action on your turn. A deployable weapon has a maneuverability of 90 degrees and begins facing in the same direction as the ship. Once a deployable weapon moves for 3 turns, it deactivates and begins drifting listlessly.
Deployable weapons can be targeted independently during flight. Each of these weapons has Armor Class 10 and 1 mega hit point.

entries.name: Fixed
entries: This weapon is mounted on one side of a ship and can only make attacks against targets within a 90-degree cone in the direction it is facing.

entries.name: Ship
entries: A ship weapon is powered by a ship and must be mounted to one to fire. This weapon can't target any creature or object that is Huge or smaller.

entries.name: Nonlethal
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points using this weapon, you can choose to knock the creature out, rendering it unconscious, rather than deal a killing blow.

entries.name: Scatter
entries: If you make an attack against a target that is within half this weapon's normal range, you deal the 'alt' damage value instead of the weapon's normal damage dice.

entries.name: Automatic
entries: When you make an attack with this weapon on your turn, you can choose to make two attacks with disadvantage instead. These attacks always have disadvantage, regardless of circumstance.

entries.name: Foregrip
entries: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. If used in two hands, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases by 200 feet.

entries.name: Sighted
entries: This weapon has disadvantage on attack rolls made against targets within 20 feet.

entries.name: Mounted
entries: This weapon is normally used while attached to a tripod, vehicle, or other bracing mount. You can mount or unmount this weapon as an action. While it is mounted, it can't be moved. It can only be used to make an attack while unmounted if held by a Medium or larger creature with a Strength score of at least 15.

entries.name: Overheat
entries: Once you make an attack with this weapon, it can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: When this weapon's projectile hits a target, it explodes in a 5-foot radius. The projectile can be fired at an unoccupied space within its range. Each creature other than the target within the blast radius must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking half the damage rolled on a failed save or no damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Heat
entries: This weapon gains a heat point whenever an attack is made with it and loses one heat point whenever you begin your turn. If the weapon gains 3 heat points, it overheats and loses all heat points. An overheated weapon can't be used to make an attack again until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Fist
entries: Attacks made with this weapon are treated as unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Attaching a Graft
entries: Attaching a graft for the first time requires a laborious surgical procedure, normally removing an original body part. This procedure takes one hour and requires a healer's kit, a set of mechanist's tools, and a knife (or a facility with access to such tools), as well as someone to perform the operation. A construct graft is permanent until another graft is provided to replace it.

Questo intervento è intensivo e richiede tempi di recupero. Quando si finisce di installare un innesto di costrutto nel proprio corpo, si perdono metà dei punti ferita e tutti i dadi ferita. Per 24 ore dopo l'installazione, non è possibile utilizzare le capacità dell'innesto, in quanto ci si adatta alla sua presenza. Sostituire un innesto o aggiungerne uno nuovo nel suo alloggiamento richiede solo 30 minuti. Quando si sostituisce un innesto si perde metà dei punti ferita, ma non si perdono dadi ferita.

entries.name: Vect Components
entries: Vect can replace sections of their bodies with customized or improved components with ease. A vect can install a construct graft on themselves with 10 minutes of work, requiring the vect to disable a part of its body, remove it, and install the new component. A vect can install construct grafts without assistance, unless the graft is installed into the Head or Arm slots.
I vettori non richiedono tempi di recupero e non subiscono penalità dopo l'aggiunta di un innesto di costrutto.

entries.name: Body Slots
entries: Ogni innesto occupa uno dei seguenti slot: Braccia, Esterno, Testa, Interno o Gambe. Non è possibile avere più di un innesto nello stesso slot del corpo. Ad esempio, se si dispone già di un innesto per le braccia, è necessario rimuoverlo prima di poterne inserire un altro.

entries.name: Ship System
entries: A ship relies on a myriad of technological systems to provide most of its noncombative functions. All ships have a ship computer which provides executive function to all its other systems, and nearly all possess a {@item life support|darkmatter} system.

Ogni sistema ha 10 mega punti ferita. Se un attacco strategico a un sistema lo riduce a 0 punti ferita, viene disattivato e non funziona finché non viene riparato (in genere richiede il lavoro di un ingegnere esperto).

I costi per l'installazione di nuovi sistemi sono riportati nella tabella Costi dei sistemi. Ulteriori regole sull'installazione di nuovi sistemi sono riportate nella sezione Personalizzazione della nave.

entries.name: Ship Weapons
entries: Le armi montate sulle navi sono tra i dispositivi più letali mai concepiti. Un colpo diretto con una qualsiasi di queste armi massicce può vaporizzare una persona non protetta, ma non è necessario nulla di meno per perforare lo scafo corazzato di una nave stellare.
Le armi montate sulla nave sono utilizzate dagli uomini dell'equipaggio nel ruolo di artigliere. Un personaggio con competenza nelle armi marziali ha anche competenza nelle armi da nave.
I danni delle armi della nave sono espressi in mega punti danno.

item.name: Dark Matter Engine
entries: Le navi spaziali nel Verso sono abbondanti e variegate e riflettono centinaia di società e le loro diverse tecnologie. Quasi tutte operano tramite un motore a Materia Oscura, una struttura di cristallo solida o reticolare circondata da dissipatori di calore, stabilizzatori e altre apparecchiature di supporto. Questi motori sono alimentati dalla magia e permettono di trasportare una nave in brevi salti nel Vuoto e di attraversare vasti golfi di spazio.

I motori a Materia Oscura sono il cuore delle astronavi. La maggior parte delle navi ha anche altri motori, chiamati motori a impulso, per viaggiare al di fuori dei salti nel vuoto, ma un motore a Materia Oscura è necessario per intraprendere qualsiasi avventura su un pianeta.

entries.name: Engine Class
entries: I motori a Materia Oscura sono il cuore delle astronavi. La maggior parte delle navi ha anche altri motori, chiamati motori a impulso, per viaggiare al di fuori dei salti nel vuoto, ma un motore a Materia Oscura è necessario per intraprendere qualsiasi avventura su un pianeta.

Se un incantatore alimenta direttamente il motore con la sua magia, può far saltare un motore di Materia Oscura altre due volte in un dato giorno. Tuttavia, motori progressivamente più potenti richiedono più magia arcana. Un motore di Classe 1 può essere alimentato da un incantesimo di 1° livello, ma un motore di Classe 2 richiede un incantesimo di 2° livello e così via.

I motori delle classi più basse sono apparentemente dei system hopper, che permettono a una piccola astronave di saltare all'interno di un singolo sistema o di compiere viaggi più lunghi tra sistemi vicini. Spesso, questo tipo di navi deve essere trasportato all'interno di astronavi di classe superiore per attraversare distanze più lunghe.

I motori di Classe 10 sono strettamente teorici o leggendari, a seconda di chi li chiede. Un motore del genere potrebbe attraversare la galassia in un solo giorno, senza bisogno di incantatori di alcun tipo, e dovrebbe essere una creazione diretta degli dei o di qualche antica e mistica razza aliena.

entries.name: Void Crystals
entries: I motori a Materia Oscura sono costruiti con cristalli di Vuoto al centro. Rari, fragili ed estratti dal Vuoto in corrispondenza degli orizzonti degli eventi dei buchi neri, questi cristalli sono tra i materiali più preziosi e volatili del Verse. Se un cristallo del Vuoto viene minimamente danneggiato, rischia non solo di diventare inutilizzabile, ma anche di collassare in un {@item sphere of annihilation|dmg}, distruggendo il resto del motore e l'intera nave. Pertanto, la maggior parte delle apparecchiature di stabilizzazione che circondano il nucleo di un motore a Materia Oscura servono solo a isolare e proteggere il cristallo al suo interno.

entries.name: Running a Dark Matter Engine
entries: A molti sembra che i motori a Materia Oscura siano irraggiungibili e perplessi, e che si comportino come esseri viventi a sé stanti. Nessun progetto di una singola razza e nessun modello in particolare rappresenta con precisione la varietà di questi motori; anche motori dello stesso modello si comportano in modo diverso quando vengono alimentati con diversi tipi di energia magica.

Quando una nave ha avuto per lungo tempo uno stregone come ingegnere, il motore a Materia Oscura può iniziare a eruttare nuvole di zolfo e zolfo e a caricarsi più velocemente quando i passeggeri della nave sono infelici. I maghi, invece, hanno motori piuttosto ordinati, anche se meticolosamente modificati, che probabilmente pulsano con raffiche ritmiche di forza quando sono impegnati in un salto. Le varianti sono infinite: i motori gestiti dagli illusionisti aberrano cromaticamente l'aria che li circonda, quelli tenuti dai druidi fanno spuntare ramoscelli ed erba nelle loro fessure e alcuni motori nanici producono una piccola quantità di birra come scarico.

entries.name: Charging a Dark Matter Engine
entries: Tutti i motori di Materia Oscura, indipendentemente dal tipo, richiedono una notevole energia per ricaricarsi prima di un salto. I modelli di motore più vecchi o usurati possono richiedere diverse ore di riscaldamento, durante le quali devono essere alimentati con un flusso continuo di energia magica. In generale, si presume che un motore richieda 1 minuto di riscaldamento prima di un salto.

item.name: Arcane Cannon
entries: This immensely sophisticated station focuses and magnifies a spellcaster's power, allowing them to cast spells that lay waste to entire fleets. To use an arcane cannon, you must be a spellcaster and be in the Gunner role. The cannon allows you to see ships as if you were on the bridge, which enables you to target ships with spells.

To use the arcane cannon, you must first use your action to charge it for one round. Charging the cannon doesn't expend a spell slot, but if the cannon is not used on the next round, it discharges harmlessly and must be charged again.

If you use your action to cast an evocation spell into the charged arcane cannon, you can choose a ship as a target instead of a creature. The spell must have a duration of Instantaneous and a range of 5 feet or greater. The GM can decide if a spell is inappropriate to be magnified by the cannon.

The arcane cannon transforms the spell into a mega spell; as such, this spell fails if it is cast within an area of gravitation. Its range and the dimensions of its spell effects are multiplied by 100, to a maximum range of 10,000 feet. Also, the spell deals mega damage instead of normal damage.

If a spell cast through the arcane cannon targeting a ship calls for a saving throw, the pilot makes that saving throw on behalf of the ship itself. Abilities like Evasion don't affect this type of saving throw.

item.name: Cloaking
entries: The engineer must use their action to activate or deactivate this system, causing the ship to become invisible or to return to visibility. This invisibility ends if your ship attacks, takes damage, moves more than 500 feet on its turn, or if anyone aboard the ship casts a spell or uses a system (such as a teleporter) that penetrates the ship's hull. The ship can be invisible for a total of 5 minutes each day, though this time doesn't need to be used in consecutive turns. This time recharges 24 hours after use.

item.name: Communications
entries: For two ships to communicate, they must both have a functioning communications system and be within 1,000 miles of one another. This system normally transmits only audio communication, and most systems also translate it to the listener's language, as per the tongues spell (though older models and those in disrepair are less likely to have this feature).

item.name: Fabricator
entries: Though most ships carry rations for long journeys, many employ a magic fabricator which replicates the effects of the create food and water spell to provide a reliable source of nourishment for the entire crew. Indeed, many view this type of system as being a part of {@item life support|darkmatter} itself.

Some ships use even more sophisticated replicators, capable of not only creating food and drink, but also capable of manufacturing just about anything, as per the fabricate spell. Though these more sophisticated systems are phenomenally expensive, they're essential for the largest of ships, which contain innumerable parts which can fail at a moment's notice. Any ship of Corvette size or larger with this system can be expected to have the fabricate version of this system installed.

item.name: Hypercapacitor
entries: A hypercapacitor is an immense secondary power cell, which slowly charges itself until it contains a staggering quantity of arcane energy. The engineer can discharge the hypercapacitor in place of supplying a spell slot of 5th level or lower to power a void jump or overcharge the engine. Once discharged, it takes 24 hours to charge, but a spellcaster can use their action and expend a spell slot of the same level as the Dark Matter engine's class to charge it early. A ship can have no more than two {@item hypercapacitor|darkmatter|hypercapacitors} installed at one time.

item.name: Life Pods
entries: In the event of catastrophic ship failure, life pods are the last hope for survival. A ship with this system has a single- person life pod for each crew member and passenger. At any time, you can use your action to board a life pod and eject from the ship. The pod travels far enough to clear any explosion of the ship, then drifts aimlessly. The pod has extremely minimal thrusters—enough to change direction two or three times—and enough air, power, and rations to sustain its passenger for 7 days. Each life pod automatically produces a distress signal that can be detected by any ship with {@item sensors|darkmatter}, though such a signal only travels at the speed of light—very slow by galactic scale. A life pod can survive reentry on most planets.

item.name: Life Support
entries: Providing a ship with air, heat, and artificial gravity, a life support system is the most integral part of a ship for its crew. If a life support system is disabled, a temporary life support system will typically be engaged, providing the ship with air and heat for up to an hour, but not restoring artificial gravity.
For less conventional starships, such as those shaped as galleons or which are built within great trees, the life support system extends a bubble of heat and atmosphere around the entire ship.

It is possible to survive for some time without a functioning life support system, as long as crew members have functioning life suits, but these alternatives are frequently a temporary stop-gap while the life support is repaired.

A crew member with sufficient privileges with the ship computer aboard the bridge of a ship can normally disable the life support manually as an action. Depending on the ship, this may allow them to vent atmosphere from the ship, disable the artificial gravity (rendering the entire ship a zero-gravity environment, if it's in space), disable the ship's heaters, or do all of those things to all or part of the ship.

item.name: Sensors
entries: The vast majority of ships are equipped with an array of sensors used to pinpoint ships and other obstacles within 100 miles. If these sensors are missing or disabled, a ship can only see and make attacks within its cone of movement.

item.name: Shield Generator
entries: A massive arcane projector, pulsing with waves of abjuration magic, a shield generator is required for a ship to have a directional shield. If it is disabled, a ship loses all of its shield points until it is repaired.

item.name: Sickbay
entries: Illness and injury are bound to happen on a starship, and without a dedicated healer onboard, a sickbay is a critical facility on any starship. This system has a pool of 6 medical dice, which are d8s. Each of these dice recharge 24 hours after being used. You can spend 1 minute in a sickbay and expend one or more of these dice to cause you or another creature in the sickbay to regain hit points equal to the value rolled.
Alternatively, you can expend 3 medical dice to cure yourself of any disease or poison afflicting you or another creature in the sickbay.

item.name: Simulator
entries: Because voyages aboard a starship can last months or even years at a time, simulating the luxuries of home can be a great boon to the crew's morale. A simulator is an immensely complex room, technically a sentient magic item, that employs dozens of systems to create the effects of the spells {@spell hallucinatory terrain} and {@spell major image} to replicate entire environments and situations. Though this system was designed to train crew members for dangerous situations and to simulate tactical battles, it is just as often employed for entertainment purposes.

item.name: Teleporters
entries: Blinking from the inside of a ship onto the surface of a planet is an invaluable function for many starships. As such, many ships contain a number of permanent teleportation circles specially designed for this type of short-range transportation. The ship's engineer can use their action to activate the teleportation system, targeting a single unmoving location within 100 miles of the ship and creating a temporary destination teleportation circle at that location. This circle lasts for 1 minute or until another teleportation circle is created. Because the resonance of a Dark Matter engine interferes with the teleportation magic, you can't create a destination circle inside a ship which has a functioning Dark Matter engine unless engineers on both ships coordinate the teleporters to allow transit.
Sometimes, a network of teleportation circles will be set up inside particularly large ships to facilitate quick navigation. Such teleporters are constantly active.

item.name: Tractor Beam
entries: A tractor beam is a very large device designed to pull spacecraft and other objects toward the ship. If you are in the Engineer role, you can use your action to make a ranged spell attack using a tractor beam. The target must be an object or ship within 3,000 feet that is less than half the size of your ship and isn't moving away from it. If you are not a spellcaster, you only add your proficiency bonus to this attack roll.

On a hit, the target is caught in the tractor beam. At the beginning of each of your turns, you can use your action to maintain the beam and pull the target up to 500 feet closer to your ship. The target can't otherwise move while it is within the tractor beam.

If the target is a ship, it can attempt to break free of the tractor beam. The pilot of the target ship can make a Dexterity (Piloting) check on its turn, opposed by your Intelligence (Technology) check. If you fail, the ship uses half its movement speed to escape the tractor beam and can move freely for the remainder of its movement.

item.name: Umbilicus
entries: An umbilicus is a long, hollow cable which extends from one ship to another (a maximum of 100 feet), allowing the transport of people and goods between the two without compromising the hull of either ship. An umbilicus is required to board another ship.

item.name: Ankh of Ra
entries: This golden holy symbol, blessed by the Sun Above, shields you from death. When you drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage while you are attuned to the ankh, you instead regain {@dice 4d10} hit points. The ankh then loses its luster and becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Arcane Terminal
entries: Arcane terminals are essential units of computing in the 'verse. Most information, from public databanks to private financial records, are stored on such terminals. These terminals weigh 800 pounds and come equipped with a keyboard, monitor, and antenna. A terminal can store data, search its contents, and transfer data to other terminals. You can enter text into a terminal using the keyboard and search for data using queries of any length. A terminal can hold an arbitrarily large amount of text; the equivalent of hundreds of encyclopedias, but its storage of images and video is much more strictly limited. If you connect an arcane terminal by cable to another terminal, a ship's computer, or a datapad, you can transfer information between these devices.

With permission, it is possible to use one terminal to search the data of another. The most common use of this is to query the extensive amoeboid Compendium, which is located on a network of arcane terminals spread across dozens of maws, accessible from any given maw.
